titles.title: Teach Me, My God and King

comments.comment: This hymnal has not been proofed - data may be incomplete or incorrect

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: Teach me, my God and King, in all things Thee to see, and what I do in anything, to do it as for Thee.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: To scorn the senses’ sway, while still to Thee I tend; in all I do be Thou the Way, in all be Thou the End.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: All may of Thee partake; nothing so small can be, but draws, when acted for Thy sake, greatness and worth from Thee.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: If done t'obey Thy laws, e’en servile labors shine; hallowed is toil, if this the cause, the meanest work divine.
